channel.title: World
channel.description: The Washington Post World section provides information and analysis of breaking world news stories. In addition to our world news and video, Post World News offers discussions and blogs on major international news and economic issues.

item.title: Protesters hurl mud at Spain’s king, queen and prime minister after floods
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Hassan
item.description: King Felipe, Queen Letizia and Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez were met with anger in Paiporta, a town badly hit by the devastating floods in Valencia.

item.title: Live briefing: Israel ends agreement with U.N. agency for Palestinians
item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger, Leo Sands, Rachel Pannett, Sammy Westfall
item.description: Israel said it has withdrawn from the 1967 deal legally recognizing UNRWA. The Knesset has passed legislation curbing the U.N. agency’s activities and privileges.

item.title: Pro-E.U. candidate wins Moldova runoff despite fears of Russian interference
item.dc:creator: Mary Ilyushina
item.description: Maia Sandu led with 55.41 percent against Alexandr Stoianoglo, a former prosecutor general backed by the pro-Russian Party of Socialists.

item.title: Israel withdraws from 1967 deal that recognizes UNRWA; agency says it is in the dark
item.dc:creator: Leo Sands, Miriam Berger

item.title: Meet the Russian blogger accused of U.S. election interference
item.dc:creator: Francesca Ebel
item.description: Blogs and programs like Mikhail Zvinchuk’s Rybar represent a transformation of Russia’s information sphere amid dissatisfaction with empty state media reports.

item.title: Israeli forces used civilians as human shields in Gaza, Palestinians and soldiers say
item.dc:creator: Louisa Loveluck, Hajar Harb, John Hudson

item.title: Where Trump and Harris stand on global issues ahead of the U.S. election
item.dc:creator: Annabelle Timsit, Kelsey Ables, Niha Masih, Adela Suliman
item.description: The new president will face a host of foreign policy challenges including immigration, climate change and wars in Ukraine and the Middle East.

item.title: As U.S. election nears, ‘fascism’ is in the spotlight again
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: Though former members of his administration have called Trump a fascist, his political prospects have not dimmed. What does that tell us about the term’s power and usefulness?

item.title: Why the U.S. election is so long and others around the world are so short
item.dc:creator: Mikhail Klimentov
item.description: The U.S. election is so long and others around the world are so short because of geography and finances.

item.title: As regional violence rages, Saudi Arabia pitches itself as investment hub
item.dc:creator: Susannah George
item.description: The summit in Riyadh, known as the Future Investment Initiative, allowed the kingdom to showcase its ambitious plans to reshape its economy.

item.title: Hundreds showed up for a Halloween parade. They got ‘ghosted.’
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Hassan
item.description: MySpiritHalloween, the website that promoted a Halloween parade in Dublin that never existed, says it is “ashamed” and blamed human error.

item.title: Entire northern Gaza population ‘at imminent risk’ of death, UNICEF head says
item.dc:creator: Niha Masih, Miriam Berger, Annabelle Timsit
item.description: The World Health Organization reported an attack on a Gaza City clinic where polio vaccination was taking place. Israel denied striking in the area at that time.

item.title: Israeli forces used civilians as human shields in Gaza, Palestinians and soldiers say
item.dc:creator: Louisa Loveluck, Hajar Harb, John Hudson
item.description: Palestinians describe being forced to carry out life-threatening tasks by Israeli forces in Gaza.

item.title: 58,000 children vaccinated against polio in north Gaza amid reported strikes
item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger, Annabelle Timsit

item.title: Israeli forces capture man in northern Lebanon, officials say
item.dc:creator: Suzan Haidamous, Bryan Pietsch, Alon Rom

item.title: Arab states resist U.S. pressure to denounce Houthis
item.dc:creator: Abigail Hauslohner, Ellen Nakashima
item.description: Attacks in the Red Sea by Yemen’s Houthis are hurting economies across the Middle East, but Arab leaders are loath to be seen siding with the U.S. and Israel.

item.title: The new season of ‘The Bachelor’ in Ukraine shows the scars of war
item.dc:creator: Francesca Ebel, Kostiantyn Khudov
item.description: The man has an easy smile, the women are gorgeously dressed, and generators fend off the blackouts with air raid shelters nearby.

item.title: Israelis and Palestinians find little hope in divisive U.S. election
item.dc:creator: Adam Taylor, Claire Parker, Hajar Harb

item.title: Israelis and Palestinians find little hope in divisive U.S. election
item.dc:creator: Adam Taylor, Claire Parker, Hajar Harb
item.description: In a region upended by a year of violence and tumult, many are looking ahead to the vote between Trump and Harris on Tuesday with a sense of resignation.

item.title: Russia feigns indifference over U.S. election but roots quietly for Trump
item.dc:creator: Francesca Ebel, Catherine Belton
item.description: Trump’s international agenda is more to the Kremlin’s tastes but even his plans for ending the war in Ukraine might not be acceptable to Putin.

item.title: Iran’s Khamenei warns of ‘crushing’ response to Israeli strikes
item.dc:creator: Adam Taylor, Mustafa Salim, Bryan Pietsch, Suzan Haidamous, Heidi Levine

item.title: Iran’s Khamenei warns of ‘crushing’ response to Israeli strikes
item.dc:creator: Adam Taylor, Mustafa Salim, Bryan Pietsch, Suzan Haidamous, Heidi Levine
item.description: Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei did not explicitly say an attack would originate from Iran, adding to speculation Tehran plans to retaliate from neighboring Iraq.

item.title: Polio vaccinations resume in Gaza City amid ‘near-impossible conditions’
item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger

item.title: Iran’s supreme leader pledges ‘crushing response’; Pentagon bolsters Middle East presence
item.dc:creator: Frances Vinall, Andrew Jeong, Steve Hendrix, Victoria Bisset, Bryan Pietsch
item.description: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei pledged a “crushing response” to Israel and the U.S., as the Pentagon said it is sending U.S. ballistic missile defense destroyers and aircraft to the Middle East.

item.title: A chaotic presidential transition could embolden U.S. adversaries
item.dc:creator: Missy Ryan, Ellen Nakashima, Dan Lamothe
item.description: U.S. officials say they are hyper-focused on any attempts by Russia, China or Iran to exploit the months between Election Day the next president’s inauguration.

item.title: China’s Typhoon hacks ahead of U.S. election spurred by elite competition
item.dc:creator: Cate Cadell
item.description: Beijing insists it won’t meddle in the U.S. vote, but it’s reaping the fruits of a years-long government effort to build an ecosystem of private hacking groups.

item.title: Israeli forces capture man in northern Lebanon, officials say
item.dc:creator: Suzan Haidamous, Bryan Pietsch, Alon Rom
